head.supplied: 2/7/85. ¶ ¶ Accept, dear Major Ellery, the small volume sent herewith. At page 364 you will see, what help is desired from your important Department for the forthcoming new Victorian Edition ¶ Regard...

div.p: MS bound into a copy of B81.01.04 inscribed: 'To Major Ellery, FRS F.R.A.S., Director of the Observatory &c. a small souvenir from the author of this unpretensive volume. July 1885.' The copy is one of three at MEL, catalogued as REF 81.13.10. 2/7/85.

Accept, dear Major Ellery, the small volume sent herewith. At page 364 you will see, what help is desired from your important Department for the forthcoming new Victorian Edition
On p. 364 of the work, which is the Sydney edition of M's Select extra-tropical plants, there appears a 'Table of Average Annual Rainfall and Temperature at Stations in New South Wales'. The equivalent information, 'Furnished by the Melbourne Observatory', appears in the new Victorian edition, B85.12.03, on pp. 413 (averages and extremes of temperature) and 414-5 (average annual rainfall); Ellery, as Government Astronomer, was head of Victoria's meteorological service.
